full_statement: There is only one true God.
technicalDefinition: Classical Christian confession of one God (against polytheism).
definition_variants: There is only one true God.
Classical Christian confession of one God (against polytheism).

full_statement: God is one God in three persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.
technicalDefinition: One divine essence (ousia) in three hypostases/persons; coequal and coeternal.
definition_variants: God is one God in three persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.
One divine essence (ousia) in three hypostases/persons; coequal and coeternal.

full_statement: Jesus is truly God.
technicalDefinition: The Son is consubstantial with the Father (homoousios).
definition_variants: Jesus is truly God.
The Son is consubstantial with the Father (homoousios).

full_statement: Jesus is truly human.
technicalDefinition: Incarnation: the Word truly assumes human nature.
definition_variants: Jesus is truly human.
Incarnation: the Word truly assumes human nature.

full_statement: God the Son became a human being in Jesus.
technicalDefinition: The eternal Logos assumes human nature without ceasing to be divine.
definition_variants: God the Son became a human being in Jesus.
The eternal Logos assumes human nature without ceasing to be divine.

full_statement: Jesus was born to Mary by a miracle; God is his Father.
technicalDefinition: Conceived by the Holy Spirit; born of the Virgin Mary.
definition_variants: Jesus was born to Mary by a miracle; God is his Father.
Conceived by the Holy Spirit; born of the Virgin Mary.

full_statement: Mary can be called 'Mother of God' because Jesus is God.
technicalDefinition: The title safeguards unity of Christ’s person; affirmed at Ephesus (431).
definition_variants: Mary can be called 'Mother of God' because Jesus is God.
The title safeguards unity of Christ’s person; affirmed at Ephesus (431).

full_statement: Jesus is one person, fully God and fully man.
technicalDefinition: Union of two natures in one hypostasis/person of the Son.
definition_variants: Jesus is one person, fully God and fully man.
Union of two natures in one hypostasis/person of the Son.

full_statement: Jesus has a divine nature and a human nature.
technicalDefinition: One person in two natures 'without confusion, change, division, separation'.
definition_variants: Jesus has a divine nature and a human nature.
One person in two natures 'without confusion, change, division, separation'.

full_statement: The Holy Spirit is truly God.
technicalDefinition: The Spirit is worshiped and glorified with the Father and the Son (381).
definition_variants: The Holy Spirit is truly God.
The Spirit is worshiped and glorified with the Father and the Son (381).

full_statement: The Spirit comes from the Father (and debate over 'and the Son').
technicalDefinition: Doctrine of eternal origin within Trinity; filioque controversy.
definition_variants: The Spirit comes from the Father (and debate over 'and the Son').
Doctrine of eternal origin within Trinity; filioque controversy.

full_statement: The Church recognizes which books belong in the Bible.
technicalDefinition: Process of reception/recognition of authoritative writings (OT/NT).
definition_variants: The Church recognizes which books belong in the Bible.
Process of reception/recognition of authoritative writings (OT/NT).

full_statement: Some churches include extra Old Testament books as Scripture.
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox accept deuterocanon; many Protestants read them but not for doctrine.
definition_variants: Some churches include extra Old Testament books as Scripture.
Catholic/Orthodox accept deuterocanon; many Protestants read them but not for doctrine.

full_statement: The faith is passed on not only by the Bible but also by church teaching and practice.
technicalDefinition: Apostolic tradition transmitted in liturgy, councils, Fathers; authoritative in Catholic/Orthodox systems.
definition_variants: The faith is passed on not only by the Bible but also by church teaching and practice.
Apostolic tradition transmitted in liturgy, councils, Fathers; authoritative in Catholic/Orthodox systems.

full_statement: The Bible is the highest authority for Christian belief.
technicalDefinition: Scripture as the only infallible rule; tradition has ministerial authority.
definition_variants: The Bible is the highest authority for Christian belief.
Scripture as the only infallible rule; tradition has ministerial authority.

full_statement: Church leaders (bishops) are ordained in a chain going back to the apostles.
technicalDefinition: Continuity of episcopal ordination and teaching as sign of catholicity.
definition_variants: Church leaders (bishops) are ordained in a chain going back to the apostles.
Continuity of episcopal ordination and teaching as sign of catholicity.

full_statement: Some churches are led by bishops.
technicalDefinition: Threefold ministry (bishop/presbyter/deacon) as normative.
definition_variants: Some churches are led by bishops.
Threefold ministry (bishop/presbyter/deacon) as normative.

full_statement: The bishop of Rome has a special leadership role over the whole Church.
technicalDefinition: Jurisdictional primacy claimed by Catholic Church; understood differently in Orthodox dialogue.
definition_variants: The bishop of Rome has a special leadership role over the whole Church.
Jurisdictional primacy claimed by Catholic Church; understood differently in Orthodox dialogue.

full_statement: In certain official teachings, the pope cannot err on faith/morals (Catholic claim).
technicalDefinition: Defined at Vatican I (1870) under specific conditions.
definition_variants: In certain official teachings, the pope cannot err on faith/morals (Catholic claim).
Defined at Vatican I (1870) under specific conditions.

full_statement: Salvation is a gift from God, not something we earn.
technicalDefinition: God’s unmerited favor and transforming help; varieties: created grace, uncreated energies, etc.
definition_variants: Salvation is a gift from God, not something we earn.
God’s unmerited favor and transforming help; varieties: created grace, uncreated energies, etc.

full_statement: How God makes a sinner right with Him.
technicalDefinition: Catholic: includes inner renewal (infused righteousness); Protestant: often forensic declaration (imputed righteousness).
definition_variants: How God makes a sinner right with Him.
Catholic: includes inner renewal (infused righteousness); Protestant: often forensic declaration (imputed righteousness).

full_statement: God declares people right by faith apart from works (a Reformation slogan).
technicalDefinition: In classical Lutheran/Reformed sense: faith alone is the instrument of justification.
definition_variants: God declares people right by faith apart from works (a Reformation slogan).
In classical Lutheran/Reformed sense: faith alone is the instrument of justification.

full_statement: Christ’s righteousness is counted to the believer.
technicalDefinition: Forensic crediting; central to many Protestant systems.
definition_variants: Christ’s righteousness is counted to the believer.
Forensic crediting; central to many Protestant systems.

full_statement: God makes the believer actually righteous inside by grace.
technicalDefinition: Justification includes sanctifying grace; Catholic/Orthodox stress transformation.
definition_variants: God makes the believer actually righteous inside by grace.
Justification includes sanctifying grace; Catholic/Orthodox stress transformation.

full_statement: God makes humans share in His life by grace (becoming like God).
technicalDefinition: Participation in divine nature/energies by grace; central in Orthodox spirituality.
definition_variants: God makes humans share in His life by grace (becoming like God).
Participation in divine nature/energies by grace; central in Orthodox spirituality.

full_statement: Humans cooperate with God’s grace in salvation.
technicalDefinition: Divine-human cooperation; strong in Catholic/Orthodox and some Protestants (e.g., Wesleyan).
definition_variants: Humans cooperate with God’s grace in salvation.
Divine-human cooperation; strong in Catholic/Orthodox and some Protestants (e.g., Wesleyan).

full_statement: God alone causes the new birth; humans don’t contribute to regeneration.
technicalDefinition: Especially in Reformed/Lutheran forms: regeneration is entirely God’s work; faith follows.
definition_variants: God alone causes the new birth; humans don’t contribute to regeneration.
Especially in Reformed/Lutheran forms: regeneration is entirely God’s work; faith follows.

full_statement: God’s plan for who will be saved.
technicalDefinition: Varies widely: Augustine; Catholic; Reformed; Wesleyan; etc.
definition_variants: God’s plan for who will be saved.
Varies widely: Augustine; Catholic; Reformed; Wesleyan; etc.

full_statement: God keeps true believers; they will endure to the end (in some traditions).
technicalDefinition: Reformed 'perseverance/preservation'; disputed by Wesleyan traditions.
definition_variants: God keeps true believers; they will endure to the end (in some traditions).
Reformed 'perseverance/preservation'; disputed by Wesleyan traditions.

full_statement: Humans inherit a broken condition from Adam.
technicalDefinition: West: inherited guilt + corruption; East often emphasizes corruption/death (ancestral) more than inherited guilt.
definition_variants: Humans inherit a broken condition from Adam.
West: inherited guilt + corruption; East often emphasizes corruption/death (ancestral) more than inherited guilt.

short_label: Number of Sacraments (7 vs 2 vs other)
full_statement: Different churches count the church’s key rituals differently.
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox commonly speak of seven; many Protestants speak of two ordinances.
definition_variants: Different churches count the church’s key rituals differently.
Catholic/Orthodox commonly speak of seven; many Protestants speak of two ordinances.

full_statement: Christian initiation with water in the name of the Trinity.
technicalDefinition: Sacrament/mystery/ordinance instituted by Christ.
definition_variants: Christian initiation with water in the name of the Trinity.
Sacrament/mystery/ordinance instituted by Christ.

full_statement: Baptizing babies of Christian families.
technicalDefinition: Practice rooted in household baptisms and covenant theology; defended in Catholic/Orthodox/Lutheran/Reformed/Methodist/Anglican traditions.
definition_variants: Baptizing babies of Christian families.
Practice rooted in household baptisms and covenant theology; defended in Catholic/Orthodox/Lutheran/Reformed/Methodist/Anglican traditions.

full_statement: Baptizing only people who personally profess faith.
technicalDefinition: Baptism following repentance/faith; common in Baptist/Anabaptist/Pentecostal traditions.
definition_variants: Baptizing only people who personally profess faith.
Baptism following repentance/faith; common in Baptist/Anabaptist/Pentecostal traditions.

full_statement: In baptism, God gives new birth (regeneration) and forgiveness.
technicalDefinition: Sacramental efficacy: baptism actually conveys grace, not merely symbolizes it.
definition_variants: In baptism, God gives new birth (regeneration) and forgiveness.
Sacramental efficacy: baptism actually conveys grace, not merely symbolizes it.

full_statement: Different ways of applying water in baptism.
technicalDefinition: Immersion often argued as NT norm; other modes defended as permissible.
definition_variants: Different ways of applying water in baptism.
Immersion often argued as NT norm; other modes defended as permissible.

full_statement: Anointing/laying on hands to strengthen baptized Christians.
technicalDefinition: Often linked with gift of Spirit; East administers at baptism; West usually later.
definition_variants: Anointing/laying on hands to strengthen baptized Christians.
Often linked with gift of Spirit; East administers at baptism; West usually later.

full_statement: Bread and wine given by Jesus as a memorial and communion in His body and blood.
technicalDefinition: Varies: sacrifice, real presence, communion, anamnesis.
definition_variants: Bread and wine given by Jesus as a memorial and communion in His body and blood.
Varies: sacrifice, real presence, communion, anamnesis.

full_statement: Christ is truly present in the Eucharist (not just a symbol).
technicalDefinition: Catholic: substantial change; Lutheran: sacramental union; Orthodox: mystery; Reformed: spiritual presence; Zwinglian: symbolic.
definition_variants: Christ is truly present in the Eucharist (not just a symbol).
Catholic: substantial change; Lutheran: sacramental union; Orthodox: mystery; Reformed: spiritual presence; Zwinglian: symbolic.

full_statement: Catholic teaching: the bread and wine become Christ’s body and blood in substance.
technicalDefinition: Defined in scholastic terms; affirmed at Trent; rejected by many Protestants (e.g., Anglican Articles).
definition_variants: Catholic teaching: the bread and wine become Christ’s body and blood in substance.
Defined in scholastic terms; affirmed at Trent; rejected by many Protestants (e.g., Anglican Articles).

full_statement: The Eucharist is connected to Christ’s one sacrifice in a sacrificial way.
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox speak of unbloody sacrifice/re-presentation; Protestants vary.
definition_variants: The Eucharist is connected to Christ’s one sacrifice in a sacrificial way.
Catholic/Orthodox speak of unbloody sacrifice/re-presentation; Protestants vary.

full_statement: Worship directed to Christ present in the Eucharist (Catholic practice).
technicalDefinition: Develops with Eucharistic theology of real presence; practiced especially in Latin Catholicism.
definition_variants: Worship directed to Christ present in the Eucharist (Catholic practice).
Develops with Eucharistic theology of real presence; practiced especially in Latin Catholicism.

short_label: Confession to a priest (Sacrament of Penance)
full_statement: Telling sins to a priest and receiving absolution.
technicalDefinition: Sacramental confession/absolution in Catholic/Orthodox; Lutheran retains private confession but varies; many Protestants do not.
definition_variants: Telling sins to a priest and receiving absolution.
Sacramental confession/absolution in Catholic/Orthodox; Lutheran retains private confession but varies; many Protestants do not.

full_statement: A post-death purification for people who die in God’s grace but still need cleansing.
technicalDefinition: Catholic doctrine; different from hell; Orthodox have prayers for dead but often reject 'purgatory' as Latin system.
definition_variants: A post-death purification for people who die in God’s grace but still need cleansing.
Catholic doctrine; different from hell; Orthodox have prayers for dead but often reject 'purgatory' as Latin system.

full_statement: Praying for departed Christians.
technicalDefinition: Common in ancient liturgy; dogmatic framing varies.
definition_variants: Praying for departed Christians.
Common in ancient liturgy; dogmatic framing varies.

full_statement: Honoring holy Christians and asking for their prayers.
technicalDefinition: Dulia (veneration) vs latria (worship) distinctions in Catholic/Orthodox; Protestants vary.
definition_variants: Honoring holy Christians and asking for their prayers.
Dulia (veneration) vs latria (worship) distinctions in Catholic/Orthodox; Protestants vary.

full_statement: Asking saints to pray for us.
technicalDefinition: Assumes communion of saints and heavenly intercession.
definition_variants: Asking saints to pray for us.
Assumes communion of saints and heavenly intercession.

full_statement: Special honor for Mary above other saints (not worship).
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox/Oriental Orthodox liturgical devotion; Protestants vary widely.
definition_variants: Special honor for Mary above other saints (not worship).
Catholic/Orthodox/Oriental Orthodox liturgical devotion; Protestants vary widely.

full_statement: Mary remained a virgin before, during, and after Jesus’ birth (in many traditions).
technicalDefinition: Ancient belief; debated among Protestants.
definition_variants: Mary remained a virgin before, during, and after Jesus’ birth (in many traditions).
Ancient belief; debated among Protestants.

full_statement: Catholic dogma: Mary was preserved from original sin from conception.
technicalDefinition: Defined 1854 (Ineffabilis Deus).
definition_variants: Catholic dogma: Mary was preserved from original sin from conception.
Defined 1854 (Ineffabilis Deus).

full_statement: Catholic dogma: Mary was taken to heaven body and soul.
technicalDefinition: Defined 1950 (Munificentissimus Deus).
definition_variants: Catholic dogma: Mary was taken to heaven body and soul.
Defined 1950 (Munificentissimus Deus).

full_statement: Using sacred images of Christ and saints in worship and prayer.
technicalDefinition: Veneration of icons affirmed at Nicaea II; honor passes to prototype.
definition_variants: Using sacred images of Christ and saints in worship and prayer.
Veneration of icons affirmed at Nicaea II; honor passes to prototype.

full_statement: Honoring physical remains or objects connected to saints.
technicalDefinition: Ancient practice; connected to saints and sanctification of matter.
definition_variants: Honoring physical remains or objects connected to saints.
Ancient practice; connected to saints and sanctification of matter.

full_statement: Structured worship with set prayers, readings, and sacraments.
technicalDefinition: Liturgy as public work of Church; ancient patterns.
definition_variants: Structured worship with set prayers, readings, and sacraments.
Liturgy as public work of Church; ancient patterns.

full_statement: Christians living in communities focused on prayer and discipline.
technicalDefinition: Develops from 3rd/4th c. desert traditions; major in East and West.
definition_variants: Christians living in communities focused on prayer and discipline.
Develops from 3rd/4th c. desert traditions; major in East and West.

full_statement: Eastern Orthodox tradition of interior prayer (e.g., Jesus Prayer).
technicalDefinition: Associated with Gregory Palamas and distinction of essence/energies.
definition_variants: Eastern Orthodox tradition of interior prayer (e.g., Jesus Prayer).
Associated with Gregory Palamas and distinction of essence/energies.

full_statement: The Bible has no errors in what it teaches (as defined by some modern statements).
technicalDefinition: Often tied to Chicago Statement (1978) and modern evangelical debates.
definition_variants: The Bible has no errors in what it teaches (as defined by some modern statements).
Often tied to Chicago Statement (1978) and modern evangelical debates.

full_statement: All Christians can approach God directly through Christ.
technicalDefinition: Reformation theme; does not necessarily deny ordained ministry.
definition_variants: All Christians can approach God directly through Christ.
Reformation theme; does not necessarily deny ordained ministry.

full_statement: Some Christians are set apart to lead worship and sacraments.
technicalDefinition: Sacrament of order; apostolic ministry; differs by tradition.
definition_variants: Some Christians are set apart to lead worship and sacraments.
Sacrament of order; apostolic ministry; differs by tradition.

full_statement: Debate over what makes sacraments 'valid' (real).
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox tie to apostolic succession and form/matter/intention; Protestants vary.
definition_variants: Debate over what makes sacraments 'valid' (real).
Catholic/Orthodox tie to apostolic succession and form/matter/intention; Protestants vary.

full_statement: Whether good works done in grace can be 'rewarded' by God.
technicalDefinition: Catholic theology of merit (condign/congruent) vs Protestant rejection of merit in justification.
definition_variants: Whether good works done in grace can be 'rewarded' by God.
Catholic theology of merit (condign/congruent) vs Protestant rejection of merit in justification.

full_statement: Growing in holiness after coming to faith.
technicalDefinition: Process of being made holy by Spirit; relation to justification differs by tradition.
definition_variants: Growing in holiness after coming to faith.
Process of being made holy by Spirit; relation to justification differs by tradition.

full_statement: How confident a believer can be that they are saved.
technicalDefinition: Ranges from strong assurance (some Reformed) to more conditional (Catholic/Wesleyan).
definition_variants: How confident a believer can be that they are saved.
Ranges from strong assurance (some Reformed) to more conditional (Catholic/Wesleyan).

full_statement: The dead will rise with bodies at the end.
technicalDefinition: Affirmed in creeds; central Christian hope.
definition_variants: The dead will rise with bodies at the end.
Affirmed in creeds; central Christian hope.

full_statement: Jesus will return to judge the living and the dead.
technicalDefinition: Affirmed in creeds; timing schemes vary.
definition_variants: Jesus will return to judge the living and the dead.
Affirmed in creeds; timing schemes vary.

full_statement: Different views about a '1,000-year' reign mentioned in Revelation 20.
technicalDefinition: Interpretive frameworks; vary across church history.
definition_variants: Different views about a '1,000-year' reign mentioned in Revelation 20.
Interpretive frameworks; vary across church history.

full_statement: Modern teaching that believers will be taken up before a tribulation period.
technicalDefinition: Popularized in 19th–20th c. dispensationalism; not a defined ancient doctrine.
definition_variants: Modern teaching that believers will be taken up before a tribulation period.
Popularized in 19th–20th c. dispensationalism; not a defined ancient doctrine.

full_statement: A special experience after conversion empowering a believer.
technicalDefinition: Often linked with tongues as initial physical evidence in classical Pentecostalism.
definition_variants: A special experience after conversion empowering a believer.
Often linked with tongues as initial physical evidence in classical Pentecostalism.

short_label: Speaking in Tongues as Initial Evidence
full_statement: Tongues are the first sign that someone was baptized in the Holy Spirit (AG teaching).
technicalDefinition: Distinctive classical Pentecostal doctrine.
definition_variants: Tongues are the first sign that someone was baptized in the Holy Spirit (AG teaching).
Distinctive classical Pentecostal doctrine.

full_statement: Spiritual gifts like healing and tongues continue today.
technicalDefinition: Opposed to cessationism; debate mostly post-Reformation.
definition_variants: Spiritual gifts like healing and tongues continue today.
Opposed to cessationism; debate mostly post-Reformation.

full_statement: Some miraculous gifts ended with the apostles.
technicalDefinition: Often tied to certain Reformed traditions; not a formal ancient dogma.
definition_variants: Some miraculous gifts ended with the apostles.
Often tied to certain Reformed traditions; not a formal ancient dogma.

full_statement: Some churches read extra books but don’t use them to prove doctrine.
technicalDefinition: Anglican Article VI stance; similar in some Protestant traditions.
definition_variants: Some churches read extra books but don’t use them to prove doctrine.
Anglican Article VI stance; similar in some Protestant traditions.

full_statement: Debate over whether church councils can define doctrine.
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox treat ecumenical councils as authoritative; many Protestants accept early councils but debate extent.
definition_variants: Debate over whether church councils can define doctrine.
Catholic/Orthodox treat ecumenical councils as authoritative; many Protestants accept early councils but debate extent.

full_statement: Catholic idea that the Church’s teaching office has authority to interpret faith.
technicalDefinition: Magisterium under pope and bishops; Scripture and Tradition interpreted authoritatively.
definition_variants: Catholic idea that the Church’s teaching office has authority to interpret faith.
Magisterium under pope and bishops; Scripture and Tradition interpreted authoritatively.

full_statement: Some wars can be morally justified under strict rules.
technicalDefinition: Develops in Augustine and later; Catholic tradition formalizes; many traditions adopt variants.
definition_variants: Some wars can be morally justified under strict rules.
Develops in Augustine and later; Catholic tradition formalizes; many traditions adopt variants.

full_statement: Christians should not use violence.
technicalDefinition: Early Christian and Anabaptist emphasis; not universal.
definition_variants: Christians should not use violence.
Early Christian and Anabaptist emphasis; not universal.

short_label: Bishops as successors of apostles (strong form)
full_statement: The apostles’ authority continues through bishops.
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox/Anglican claim; contested in some Protestant ecclesiology.
definition_variants: The apostles’ authority continues through bishops.
Catholic/Orthodox/Anglican claim; contested in some Protestant ecclesiology.

full_statement: The Lord’s Supper is mainly a symbolic remembrance.
technicalDefinition: Christ not present in a unique sacramental way; common in many free churches.
definition_variants: The Lord’s Supper is mainly a symbolic remembrance.
Christ not present in a unique sacramental way; common in many free churches.

full_statement: Christ is really present spiritually to believers in Communion.
technicalDefinition: Reformed view (Calvin) distinct from Lutheran and memorialist positions.
definition_variants: Christ is really present spiritually to believers in Communion.
Reformed view (Calvin) distinct from Lutheran and memorialist positions.

full_statement: Christ’s body and blood are truly given with bread and wine.
technicalDefinition: Often called 'in, with, under' the elements; rejects transubstantiation terminology.
definition_variants: Christ’s body and blood are truly given with bread and wine.
Often called 'in, with, under' the elements; rejects transubstantiation terminology.

full_statement: Only certain people (e.g., members) may receive Communion.
technicalDefinition: Practiced in some traditions; based on discipline and unity concerns.
definition_variants: Only certain people (e.g., members) may receive Communion.
Practiced in some traditions; based on discipline and unity concerns.

full_statement: Church can exclude members for serious sin or heresy.
technicalDefinition: Ancient practice; various forms across traditions.
definition_variants: Church can exclude members for serious sin or heresy.
Ancient practice; various forms across traditions.

full_statement: Catholic practice connected to remission of temporal punishment for sin.
technicalDefinition: Develops in medieval Latin church; abuses contribute to Reformation controversy.
definition_variants: Catholic practice connected to remission of temporal punishment for sin.
Develops in medieval Latin church; abuses contribute to Reformation controversy.

full_statement: A proposed state for unbaptized infants (historical Catholic speculation).
technicalDefinition: Not defined dogma; debated; largely abandoned in modern catechesis.
definition_variants: A proposed state for unbaptized infants (historical Catholic speculation).
Not defined dogma; debated; largely abandoned in modern catechesis.

full_statement: Some churches require priests to remain unmarried.
technicalDefinition: Latin Catholic discipline; Eastern Catholic/Orthodox allow married priests (with restrictions).
definition_variants: Some churches require priests to remain unmarried.
Latin Catholic discipline; Eastern Catholic/Orthodox allow married priests (with restrictions).

full_statement: Marriage is a sacred sign of God’s grace (in some traditions).
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox count marriage as sacrament/mystery; Protestants vary.
definition_variants: Marriage is a sacred sign of God’s grace (in some traditions).
Catholic/Orthodox count marriage as sacrament/mystery; Protestants vary.

full_statement: Prayer and anointing for healing/for the sick.
technicalDefinition: Sacrament in Catholic/Orthodox; James 5 basis; Protestants vary.
definition_variants: Prayer and anointing for healing/for the sick.
Sacrament in Catholic/Orthodox; James 5 basis; Protestants vary.

full_statement: The Bible contains everything necessary for salvation.
technicalDefinition: Article VI: what cannot be read/proved from Scripture not required as article of faith.
definition_variants: The Bible contains everything necessary for salvation.
Article VI: what cannot be read/proved from Scripture not required as article of faith.

full_statement: Christ took the punishment we deserved.
technicalDefinition: Reformation/evangelical dominant model; present in some patristic seeds but modern framing varies.
definition_variants: Christ took the punishment we deserved.
Reformation/evangelical dominant model; present in some patristic seeds but modern framing varies.

full_statement: Christ defeats sin, death, and the devil.
technicalDefinition: Classic patristic theme; often linked with resurrection and liberation.
definition_variants: Christ defeats sin, death, and the devil.
Classic patristic theme; often linked with resurrection and liberation.

full_statement: Christ satisfies divine justice/honor.
technicalDefinition: Medieval Western model; influences Catholic and Protestant theology.
definition_variants: Christ satisfies divine justice/honor.
Medieval Western model; influences Catholic and Protestant theology.

full_statement: God normally gives grace through the Church’s sacraments.
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox framework; Protestantism varies.
definition_variants: God normally gives grace through the Church’s sacraments.
Catholic/Orthodox framework; Protestantism varies.

full_statement: Distinction between the church seen on earth and the true spiritual body of believers.
technicalDefinition: Often in Protestant ecclesiology; Catholic/Orthodox emphasize visible communion.
definition_variants: Distinction between the church seen on earth and the true spiritual body of believers.
Often in Protestant ecclesiology; Catholic/Orthodox emphasize visible communion.

short_label: One Holy Catholic and Apostolic Church
full_statement: The Church is one, holy, worldwide (catholic), and built on apostles.
technicalDefinition: Creedal mark of church; interpreted differently by communions.
definition_variants: The Church is one, holy, worldwide (catholic), and built on apostles.
Creedal mark of church; interpreted differently by communions.

full_statement: Early Christians used a shared summary of belief to read Scripture.
technicalDefinition: Regula fidei; used against heresies (e.g., Irenaeus).
definition_variants: Early Christians used a shared summary of belief to read Scripture.
Regula fidei; used against heresies (e.g., Irenaeus).

full_statement: Ancient idea of five main episcopal sees: Rome, Constantinople, Alexandria, Antioch, Jerusalem.
technicalDefinition: Administrative model in Byzantine era; not accepted the same way everywhere.
definition_variants: Ancient idea of five main episcopal sees: Rome, Constantinople, Alexandria, Antioch, Jerusalem.
Administrative model in Byzantine era; not accepted the same way everywhere.

full_statement: Some Orthodox churches govern themselves while sharing the same faith.
technicalDefinition: Self-headed national/regional churches (e.g., Russian, Greek).
definition_variants: Some Orthodox churches govern themselves while sharing the same faith.
Self-headed national/regional churches (e.g., Russian, Greek).

full_statement: Church decisions are made together in councils/synods.
technicalDefinition: Strong in Orthodox ecclesiology; also in Catholic (especially Vatican II era) and others.
definition_variants: Church decisions are made together in councils/synods.
Strong in Orthodox ecclesiology; also in Catholic (especially Vatican II era) and others.

full_statement: Rome has a unique place because of Peter and Paul.
technicalDefinition: Basis for primacy arguments; interpreted differently across traditions.
definition_variants: Rome has a unique place because of Peter and Paul.
Basis for primacy arguments; interpreted differently across traditions.

full_statement: Final separation from God for the unrepentant.
technicalDefinition: Creedal/conciliar background; debates on nature/eternity exist.
definition_variants: Final separation from God for the unrepentant.
Creedal/conciliar background; debates on nature/eternity exist.

full_statement: Jesus is one united nature from two (divine and human) without mixing.
technicalDefinition: Miaphysis: one composite united nature of the incarnate Word; rejects 'one nature' in Eutychian sense.
definition_variants: Jesus is one united nature from two (divine and human) without mixing.
Miaphysis: one composite united nature of the incarnate Word; rejects 'one nature' in Eutychian sense.

full_statement: Jesus has two natures, divine and human, united in one person.
technicalDefinition: Chalcedon: two natures without confusion/change/division/separation.
definition_variants: Jesus has two natures, divine and human, united in one person.
Chalcedon: two natures without confusion/change/division/separation.

full_statement: Teaching (as understood by opponents) that splits Jesus into two persons.
technicalDefinition: Condemned at Ephesus; Church of the East’s later theology is more nuanced than the label suggests.
definition_variants: Teaching (as understood by opponents) that splits Jesus into two persons.
Condemned at Ephesus; Church of the East’s later theology is more nuanced than the label suggests.

full_statement: Jesus has a divine will and a human will.
technicalDefinition: Defined against monothelitism at Constantinople III (680–681).
definition_variants: Jesus has a divine will and a human will.
Defined against monothelitism at Constantinople III (680–681).

full_statement: Teaching that Jesus had only one will.
technicalDefinition: Rejected by Constantinople III.
definition_variants: Teaching that Jesus had only one will.
Rejected by Constantinople III.

full_statement: Sin affects every part of a person so they cannot save themselves.
technicalDefinition: One point in later TULIP summary; not 'as bad as possible' but morally unable to turn to God without grace.
definition_variants: Sin affects every part of a person so they cannot save themselves.
One point in later TULIP summary; not 'as bad as possible' but morally unable to turn to God without grace.

full_statement: God gives grace to all people that enables them to respond to Him.
technicalDefinition: Grace that comes before conversion, restoring ability to choose; key in Wesleyan-Arminian theology.
definition_variants: God gives grace to all people that enables them to respond to Him.
Grace that comes before conversion, restoring ability to choose; key in Wesleyan-Arminian theology.

full_statement: Christ died effectively for the elect (in some Reformed views).
technicalDefinition: Debated; related to Dort; often framed as intent/efficacy.
definition_variants: Christ died effectively for the elect (in some Reformed views).
Debated; related to Dort; often framed as intent/efficacy.

full_statement: Christ died for all people, offering salvation to everyone.
technicalDefinition: Contrasts with some Reformed readings; held in many Wesleyan/evangelical contexts.
definition_variants: Christ died for all people, offering salvation to everyone.
Contrasts with some Reformed readings; held in many Wesleyan/evangelical contexts.

full_statement: God chooses some to salvation and passes over/ordains others to judgment (in some systems).
technicalDefinition: High-Reformed doctrine in some confessional interpretations; controversial even within Reformed family.
definition_variants: God chooses some to salvation and passes over/ordains others to judgment (in some systems).
High-Reformed doctrine in some confessional interpretations; controversial even within Reformed family.

full_statement: Some churches use leavened bread; others use unleavened wafers.
technicalDefinition: East commonly leavened; Latin West commonly unleavened; not a dogma but a long-standing practice difference.
definition_variants: Some churches use leavened bread; others use unleavened wafers.
East commonly leavened; Latin West commonly unleavened; not a dogma but a long-standing practice difference.

short_label: Communion in Both Kinds (bread and wine)
full_statement: Whether laity receive both bread and wine.
technicalDefinition: Practice varies historically; restored widely in many traditions.
definition_variants: Whether laity receive both bread and wine.
Practice varies historically; restored widely in many traditions.

full_statement: Destroying or banning icons as idolatrous.
technicalDefinition: Rejected at Nicaea II; complex historical movement.
definition_variants: Destroying or banning icons as idolatrous.
Rejected at Nicaea II; complex historical movement.

full_statement: Catholics treat certain extra OT books as Scripture.
technicalDefinition: Received in Catholic canon; Protestants often classify as Apocrypha.
definition_variants: Catholics treat certain extra OT books as Scripture.
Received in Catholic canon; Protestants often classify as Apocrypha.

full_statement: Ethiopian tradition includes a larger set of biblical books.
technicalDefinition: Ethiopian canon historically broader than most other traditions.
definition_variants: Ethiopian tradition includes a larger set of biblical books.
Ethiopian canon historically broader than most other traditions.

full_statement: A unique East Syriac sacramental practice tied to the Eucharist.
technicalDefinition: Listed as sacrament in Assyrian tradition; sometimes linked to 'Holy Leaven' (malka).
definition_variants: A unique East Syriac sacramental practice tied to the Eucharist.
Listed as sacrament in Assyrian tradition; sometimes linked to 'Holy Leaven' (malka).

short_label: Sign of the Cross (as sacramental in Assyrian list)
full_statement: Making the sign of the cross as a sacred act.
technicalDefinition: Assyrian tradition lists as sacrament; widely practiced devotion elsewhere too.
definition_variants: Making the sign of the cross as a sacred act.
Assyrian tradition lists as sacrament; widely practiced devotion elsewhere too.

short_label: Conciliar vs Papal Model of Authority
full_statement: Debate over whether councils or a pope are the highest authority.
technicalDefinition: Orthodox conciliarity vs Catholic papal primacy; Protestant confessional authority differs.
definition_variants: Debate over whether councils or a pope are the highest authority.
Orthodox conciliarity vs Catholic papal primacy; Protestant confessional authority differs.

full_statement: Eastern tradition that Mary 'fell asleep' (died) and was taken to glory.
technicalDefinition: Liturgical feast; not defined the same way as Catholic Assumption dogma.
definition_variants: Eastern tradition that Mary 'fell asleep' (died) and was taken to glory.
Liturgical feast; not defined the same way as Catholic Assumption dogma.

full_statement: God’s Spirit lives in believers.
technicalDefinition: Common Christian doctrine; linked to sanctification and adoption.
definition_variants: God’s Spirit lives in believers.
Common Christian doctrine; linked to sanctification and adoption.

full_statement: Some Christians allow art but not veneration.
technicalDefinition: Common in many Protestant traditions; differs from Nicaea II theology.
definition_variants: Some Christians allow art but not veneration.
Common in many Protestant traditions; differs from Nicaea II theology.

full_statement: Whether women can be ordained as clergy.
technicalDefinition: Modern disputed issue; varies widely among Anglicans, some Protestants; Catholic/Orthodox generally reject priestly ordination of women.
definition_variants: Whether women can be ordained as clergy.
Modern disputed issue; varies widely among Anglicans, some Protestants; Catholic/Orthodox generally reject priestly ordination of women.

full_statement: A church formally connected to a state government.
technicalDefinition: Historically common (Byzantine, medieval Latin, Anglican establishments); contested in modern pluralism.
definition_variants: A church formally connected to a state government.
Historically common (Byzantine, medieval Latin, Anglican establishments); contested in modern pluralism.

full_statement: Church and government should be institutionally separate.
technicalDefinition: Develops in post-Reformation and modern contexts; Anabaptist and Baptist streams influential.
definition_variants: Church and government should be institutionally separate.
Develops in post-Reformation and modern contexts; Anabaptist and Baptist streams influential.

full_statement: Keeping Saturday as the Sabbath day.
technicalDefinition: Distinctive SDA and some other groups; most Christians historically worship Sunday as Lord’s Day.
definition_variants: Keeping Saturday as the Sabbath day.
Distinctive SDA and some other groups; most Christians historically worship Sunday as Lord’s Day.

full_statement: Most Christians worship on Sunday in honor of Jesus’ resurrection.
technicalDefinition: Ancient practice; later formalized in various ways.
definition_variants: Most Christians worship on Sunday in honor of Jesus’ resurrection.
Ancient practice; later formalized in various ways.

full_statement: A modern system dividing history into 'dispensations' with specific prophecy schemes.
technicalDefinition: Develops in 19th century (Darby) and popularized via Scofield; shapes rapture doctrine.
definition_variants: A modern system dividing history into 'dispensations' with specific prophecy schemes.
Develops in 19th century (Darby) and popularized via Scofield; shapes rapture doctrine.

full_statement: Ideal of radical poverty as Christian perfection.
technicalDefinition: Medieval spiritual movement; not universal doctrine.
definition_variants: Ideal of radical poverty as Christian perfection.
Medieval spiritual movement; not universal doctrine.

short_label: Sacramental Union of Justification and Baptism (Catholic)
full_statement: Catholics link baptism closely with justification/new birth.
technicalDefinition: Baptism as sacrament of faith that removes sin and initiates justification.
definition_variants: Catholics link baptism closely with justification/new birth.
Baptism as sacrament of faith that removes sin and initiates justification.

full_statement: God gives new life before a person can truly believe.
technicalDefinition: Order of salvation (ordo salutis) in some Calvinist theology.
definition_variants: God gives new life before a person can truly believe.
Order of salvation (ordo salutis) in some Calvinist theology.

full_statement: A person believes and then is born again (in some frameworks).
technicalDefinition: Arminian/Wesleyan order differs from some Reformed order; debated.
definition_variants: A person believes and then is born again (in some frameworks).
Arminian/Wesleyan order differs from some Reformed order; debated.

full_statement: Unity means being in the same sacramental/episcopal communion.
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox/Oriental Orthodox emphasize visible communion; Protestants often allow more plural unity models.
definition_variants: Unity means being in the same sacramental/episcopal communion.
Catholic/Orthodox/Oriental Orthodox emphasize visible communion; Protestants often allow more plural unity models.

full_statement: Unity can exist across denominations through shared faith in Christ.
technicalDefinition: Often in evangelical/protestant ecumenism.
definition_variants: Unity can exist across denominations through shared faith in Christ.
Often in evangelical/protestant ecumenism.

full_statement: The wicked are destroyed rather than punished forever (held by some groups).
technicalDefinition: Minority view historically; sometimes associated with Adventist tradition (varies).
definition_variants: The wicked are destroyed rather than punished forever (held by some groups).
Minority view historically; sometimes associated with Adventist tradition (varies).

full_statement: All people will eventually be saved (minority view).
technicalDefinition: Appears in some early thinkers and modern movements; not creedal mainstream.
definition_variants: All people will eventually be saved (minority view).
Appears in some early thinkers and modern movements; not creedal mainstream.

full_statement: Annual cycle of celebrations like Easter, Christmas, saints’ days.
technicalDefinition: Develops early; extensive in Catholic/Orthodox; adopted in some Protestant liturgies.
definition_variants: Annual cycle of celebrations like Easter, Christmas, saints’ days.
Develops early; extensive in Catholic/Orthodox; adopted in some Protestant liturgies.

full_statement: Prayer asking the Holy Spirit to sanctify the gifts in Communion.
technicalDefinition: Strongly emphasized in Eastern liturgies; present in some forms in the West.
definition_variants: Prayer asking the Holy Spirit to sanctify the gifts in Communion.
Strongly emphasized in Eastern liturgies; present in some forms in the West.

full_statement: Some Lutherans keep private confession and absolution.
technicalDefinition: Book of Concord commends confession; practice varies by church body.
definition_variants: Some Lutherans keep private confession and absolution.
Book of Concord commends confession; practice varies by church body.

full_statement: Baptism marks someone as belonging to God’s covenant community.
technicalDefinition: Sign and seal in covenant theology; linked with infant baptism.
definition_variants: Baptism marks someone as belonging to God’s covenant community.
Sign and seal in covenant theology; linked with infant baptism.

full_statement: Local church governs itself (no bishops).
technicalDefinition: Common in Baptists and many free churches.
definition_variants: Local church governs itself (no bishops).
Common in Baptists and many free churches.

full_statement: Church is governed by elders in councils (sessions, presbyteries).
technicalDefinition: Reformed/Presbyterian structure.
definition_variants: Church is governed by elders in councils (sessions, presbyteries).
Reformed/Presbyterian structure.

full_statement: Church is governed by bishops.
technicalDefinition: Catholic/Orthodox/Anglican forms; differs internally.
definition_variants: Church is governed by bishops.
Catholic/Orthodox/Anglican forms; differs internally.

full_statement: Pentecostal-like spiritual gifts within Catholic/Orthodox/Anglican/Protestant contexts.
technicalDefinition: 20th century movement; differs from classical Pentecostal denominations.
definition_variants: Pentecostal-like spiritual gifts within Catholic/Orthodox/Anglican/Protestant contexts.
20th century movement; differs from classical Pentecostal denominations.

full_statement: Any baptized believer may receive Communion.
technicalDefinition: Common in many Protestant churches; differs from closed communion discipline.
definition_variants: Any baptized believer may receive Communion.
Common in many Protestant churches; differs from closed communion discipline.

short_label: Baptism of Desire / Baptism of Blood (Catholic concept)
full_statement: God can save people who aren’t baptized with water but desire it or die for Christ.
technicalDefinition: Catholic theological explanations of salvation outside sacramental reception; not negating baptism’s norm.
definition_variants: God can save people who aren’t baptized with water but desire it or die for Christ.
Catholic theological explanations of salvation outside sacramental reception; not negating baptism’s norm.

full_statement: Using an image as a reminder is not the same as worshiping it.
technicalDefinition: Key logic in icon veneration theology (prototype distinction).
definition_variants: Using an image as a reminder is not the same as worshiping it.
Key logic in icon veneration theology (prototype distinction).

full_statement: Many early Christians believed Mary was always a virgin.
technicalDefinition: Widely attested early; later Protestant debate.
definition_variants: Many early Christians believed Mary was always a virgin.
Widely attested early; later Protestant debate.

full_statement: Churches define belief through written confessions (Reformation-era).
technicalDefinition: Augsburg, Westminster, 39 Articles, etc as identity markers.
definition_variants: Churches define belief through written confessions (Reformation-era).
Augsburg, Westminster, 39 Articles, etc as identity markers.

full_statement: Some beliefs get clarified or expanded over time.
technicalDefinition: Newman’s concept (Catholic) and broader historical method; distinct from 'new inventions'.
definition_variants: Some beliefs get clarified or expanded over time.
Newman’s concept (Catholic) and broader historical method; distinct from 'new inventions'.

full_statement: Names for teachings the church rejected.
technicalDefinition: Heresy labels are historically situated; sometimes used polemically; careful definition needed.
definition_variants: Names for teachings the church rejected.
Heresy labels are historically situated; sometimes used polemically; careful definition needed.
